name: Forest of Arden Marriott Hotel & Country Club

reviews.text: If like me you enjoy golf then this is the perfect getaway, I have never stayed at a Marriott hotel before but if all Marriott hotels are like forest of Arden I will put Marriott on top of my list of preferred hotels.
reviews.title: Great Golfing Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From check in to check out every member of staff we came across were very helpful and friendly, spacious rooms with everything you would expect the one down side is you have to pay extra for internet use, for the price you are paying this should be complimentary.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: The hotel itself is located in a scenic location in the countryside and very close to Birmingham International Airport and the NEC, locally you can go to the village shops in Meriden if you don’t wish to pay for the bar food or wish to try something in the restaurant.
reviews.title: Lovely location and beautiful rooms

reviews.text: The rooms are clean, spacious with great views from the window and the hotels car park is always busy but you would never guess, as he hotel itself is very calm and relaxing.
reviews.title: Lovely location close to the NEC, Airport and Train station.

reviews.text: Overall the hotel and resort is amazing and I will defiantly be returning some time in the near future.
reviews.title: Beautiful setting

reviews.text: I guess when you're paying the kind of money this place is looking for you expect a little better than you might otherwise have when staying at cheaper hotels.
reviews.title: Superb venue, let down by details.

reviews.text: Arrival is by a long scenic driveway and is very impressive. Likewise, the lobby is small but welcoming. Having arrived at 8am, I thought I would chance my arm and see if I could check in, and I could! They were quite happy to accept a number of guests arriving at this time (attending a conference).
reviews.title: spa day experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On to the room itself. The room is as you'd expect in a hotel of this standard, well presented with a kingsize bed with duvet and god only knows how many pillows and cushions, LCD TV with a lot of channels, ethernet connection, tea/coffee service, minibar, safe, iron and board. Pretty well equipped all told. The en-suite it similarly well equipped and on first glance is quite nice.
reviews.title: Great golf, good hotel

reviews.text: Where the room is let down is in the cleaning. In the bathroom, the toilet had not been properly cleaned and on lifting the toilet seat found that the rim was only partially cleaned from the last male guest. Likewise the bath/shower wasn't properly cleaned. The bedroom had some cobwebs around the window and also on the ceiling.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel nad Golf Courses

reviews.text: Facilities in the hotel include a very impressive leisure center with a nice pool, jacuzzi, steam room, sauna and a fully equipped gym. Towels are provided for guests.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel very pleasant staff

reviews.text: We spent a weekend at this hotel. The premium room is a good size , overlooking the golf course, with a super kingsize bed, the bathroom was ok, and it was all vey clean. staff helpfull, friendly and very polite. It was about a 5 minute walk to get down to reception, as the hotel is quite big, so if you smoke, it's probably best to ask for a room closer to the main entrance!
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay

reviews.text: My only criticism is NOT having free wifi in our room, it's there, but for quite a hefty charge.
reviews.title: So much wasted potential

reviews.text: We stayed at Forest of Arden on a busy weekend, with 3 weddings on the Saturday. Despite this, the staff in the hotel were absolutely first rate. Unfortunately, however, the hotel is rather tired, in need of extensive refurbishment and is massively inferior to other Marriotts we have stayed in the UK. As other reviewers have mentioned, the hotel layout is terrible. And our small room had a incredibly hard bed and no a/c.
reviews.title: Fine if you're into Golfing - little else to recommend it

reviews.text: We had lunch on the terrace, which was very pleasant and dined in the evening at the "Oakes Grill" - which feels more like a canteen than a restaurant. That said, the food was fine and the service was excellent.
reviews.title: Spa Day ! Great !

reviews.text: The golf is perhaps the most over-rated experience I have ever had. The staff in the golf shop are rude and disinterested, golfers are crammed onto the courses at 8 minute intervals (we found ourselves waiting to play almost every shot over the 2 rounds) and the courses are good, but nothing to get too excited about. People who rave about it should take a trip to Scotland, Ireland, Spain or Portugal. When we told the starter it had taken us 5 hours to play the Arden course he said that was "fantastic" - and they claim the course is worth £110 per round!! This is simply a large corporation's focus on bucks at the expense of the golfing experience.
reviews.title: Fantastic golf break

reviews.text: We stayed at The Forest of Arden Marriott on 10th December for my work Christmas party. We had a comfortable and clean double bedroom with all mod cons, although I did notice that the bathroom pedal bin had not been emptied when we got into our room.
reviews.title: Beautiful location, everything you would expect from a 4* country hotel

reviews.text: The beds were very comfortable, and the facilities on offer were outstanding. The spa and pool = great, the 2 golf courses, WOW. It was a real shame we didn't have time to play but I think we'll be going back just to experience that - absolutely stunning grounds and golf courses!
reviews.title: Superb friendly hotel with great service

reviews.text: I don't think I can comment fairly on the evening menu/food as it was a special Christmas menu which had clearly been devised to cater for large numbers of people and I do not know if the food we received was reflective of their usual meals in the restaurant. However, breakfast the next morning was fantastic, really good quality, plenty of choice and much better than some other hotel hot/cold buffet breakfasts I've had!
reviews.title: Absolutely stunning in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our porter was delightful and the reception staff were outstanding. We had a fantastic time and will definitely be back!!
reviews.title: We won't be going back!

reviews.text: Three of us have just returned from this hotel . We were all very impressed. We were golfers on a very reasonable deal booked through golf breaks. The hotel was high in standards but very relaxing . The leisure facilities are superb , as are the golf courses particularly the back nine on the Arden course . We are well travelled in the golfing world but have never putted on greens with so many deer watching! Truly amazing.I am told its very busy in the summer but pick your time in the winter , get lucky with the weather and the whole experience is superb, we would definitely return
reviews.title: Good Hotel

aka: Forest Of Arden Marriott Hotel And Country Club
